class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(Complete Topic: Gender and Sexuality in Shakespeare's Plays)
(This course will consider the representation of gender and sexuality in Shakespeare's plays. We will pay special attention to the cross-dressing comedies in which boy actors played women who disguise themselves as men,and consider what they say about the enactment of gender roles on stage and in society. We will also adopt an intersectional approach, considering the relations among gender, race, religion, and class. Plays to be read may include The Taming of the Shrew, The Merchant of Venice, As You Like It, Twelfth Night, and Measure for Measure.)
course_description: Every semester. Freshmen only. Through readings on variable topics, frequent writing assignments, and in-class discussions, the seminar emphasizes reasoned discourse and intellectual community. Does not satisfy first-year writing requirement.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 2120, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: R. Knecht, Status: Closed
